definition-item.definition-title: SEWING (appliances for the tailoring trade A41H; sewing tables A47B29/00; sewing in bookbinding B42B2/00; sewing machines modified for knitting D04B39/08)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sewing apparatus or machines
Sewing processes dependent on their use
The thread seams produced thereby
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of garments (e.g. stitches) or of their making
Sewing tables (as furniture)
Permanently attaching together sheets, quires or signatures by stitching with filamentary material, e.g. textile thread (i.e. sewing in bookbinding)
Sewing machines modified for knitting

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making non-wovens
Embroidering and tufting

section-body.paragraph-text: The classification in D05B is desirably complemented by a classification in the indexing scheme relating to sewing, embroidering and tufting
Selection of machines, accessories or parts of the same kind D05D2203/00
Interface between the operator and the machine D05D2205/00
Use of special elements D05D2207/00
Use of special materials D05D2209/00
Applied objects or articles D05D2303/00
Operations on the work before or after sewing D05D2305/00
In addition, the classification in D05B is desirably complemented by a classification for the application in the indexing scheme relating to textiles
Wearing apparel D10B2501/00
Domestic or personal D10B2503/00
Industrial D10B2505/00
Sport; military D10B2507/00
Medical; hygiene D10B2509/00
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sewing
Uniting or fastening by stitches.

definition-item.definition-title: General types of sewing apparatus or machines without mechanism for lateral movement of the needle or the work or both

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sewing apparatus or machines wherein neither the needle nor the work moves laterally.

definition-item.definition-title: Running-stitch seams

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: A running-stitch
Basic stitch done through one or more layers, worked by passing the needle in and out the workpiece

definition-item.definition-title: Single chain-stitch seams

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Single chain stitch seams
Seams forming a chain on the upper surface of the workpiece.

definition-item.definition-title: Lock-stitch seams

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lock-stitch seams
Seams using two threads, an upper and a lower, which lock together in the hole in the workpiece they pass through

definition-item.definition-title: Overedge seams

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Overedge seams
Seams that are typically used for sewing together and edge-finishing two fabric layers in one step

definition-item.definition-title: for making blind-stitch seams

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Blind stitch seams
Seams that are typically used for attaching lining to a garment where the stitches should not show on either side.

definition-item.definition-title: for making fluid-tight seams (sewing machines for concurrently making thread and welded seams D05B17/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus or machines for making non-welded fluid tight seams by sewing.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sewing machines for concurrently making thread and welded seams

definition-item.definition-title: Sewing apparatus or machines with mechanism for lateral movement of the needle or the work or both for making ornamental pattern seams, for sewing buttonholes, for reinforcing openings, or for fastening articles, e.g. buttons, by sewing (programme-controlled sewing machines D05B19/00; with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier D05B21/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sewing apparatus or machines with mechanism for lateral movement of the needle or the work or both, e.g. for bar-tacking, i.e. forming series of stitches used for reinforcing areas of stress on a garment, such as pocket openings.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sewing machines characterised by the programme control for lateral movement of the needle or the work or both
Sewing machines characterised by devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam

definition-item.definition-title: for making piped openings

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Piped openings
are openings e.g. formed for making pockets in a garment. The machines for making piped openings may have two needles

definition-item.definition-title: for fastening articles by sewing

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Codes related to applied objects or articles

definition-item.definition-title: Sewing machines for temporarily connecting articles, e.g. pairs of socks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sewing machines for temporarily connecting articles, e.g. for joining knitted articles.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pairing socks
Devices for keeping articles together during laundering, e.g. for keeping socks in pairs

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Overlocking machine
Type of machine often used for temporarily connecting articles

definition-item.definition-title: Linking machines, e.g. for joining knitted fabrics

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
linking machines, e.g. for joining knitted fabrics, e.g. overlocking machines.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Code related to operations on the work before or after sewing

section-body.paragraph-text: Machines provided with means for sewing and knitting to create a single article are classified in the field where the alleged invention lies. A combined knitting-sewing machine where the invention lies in the sewing is classified in sewing only.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Linking
Coupling or connecting by or as if by a link

definition-item.definition-title: Hem-stitch sewing machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Hem-stitch machines, i.e. machines having one or two needles, and a piercer.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hem
Border of a cloth article doubled back and stitched down.

section-body.paragraph-text: In patent documents the expression "hem-stitch sewing machines" is often used as synonym for " hemming machine".

definition-item.definition-title: Machines for sewing quilts or mattresses (control of workpiece-holding frames, or of sewing machines, in order to obtain particular seam configuration D05B21/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control of workpiece-holding frames, or of sewing machines, in order to obtain particular seam configuration

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spring mattresses
Stuffed mattresses
Worktables or workframes specially for upholstery
Worktables or workframes specially for upholstery

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Quilt
Coverlet of two or more layers of cloth filled with padding held in place by stitched designs
Mattress
Fabric case filled with resilient material (as cotton, hair, feathers, foam rubber, or an arrangement of coiled springs), used either alone as a bed or on a bedstead

definition-item.definition-title: Machines for sewing sacks

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Inflatable occupant restraints or confinements designed to inflate upon impact or impending impact, e.g. air bags

definition-item.definition-title: for closing filled bags or sacks (combined with bag- or sack-filling apparatus B65B)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for sewing sacks combined with bag- or sack-filling apparatus
Machines for sewing sacks combined with bag- or sack-filling apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: Machines for sewing leather goods (making pseudo-lock-stitch seams D05B1/16)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines specifically designed for sewing leather goods, i.e. suitcases, bags, and shoes.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for making pseudo-lock-stitch seams
Seat coverings for vehicles by sewing, stitching or threading
Manufacturing methods specially adapted for seat coverings

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Seat coverings in general

definition-item.definition-title: Sewing machines for concurrently making thread and welded seams (for making non-welded fluid-tight seams D05B1/26)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines for concurrently making thread and welded seams using i.e. heat, pressure, ultrasonic means, infrared means, laser or fusible materials.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sewing machines for making non-welded fluid-tight seams

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Welding
Uniting by heating and allowing the products to flow together, i.e. by compressing

definition-item.definition-title: Programme-controlled sewing machines (with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier D05B21/00; devices for stopping drive when sewing tools have reached a predetermined position D05B69/22)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Programme-controlled sewing machines, i.e. machines using computer means.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Programme-controlled sewing machines with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam
Programme-controlled devices for stopping drive when sewing tools have reached a predetermined position

definition-item.definition-title: {Zig-zag sewing machines with electric or electronic programming}

section-body.paragraph-text: Group D05B19/003 is no longer used for classification. Documents are in the process of being reorganised to groups D05B19/02 - D05B19/16.

definition-item.definition-title: Sewing machines with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam, e.g. programme-controlled for sewing collars, for attaching pockets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sewing machines with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam, e.g. programme-controlled for sewing collars, for attaching pockets, bar tacking.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bar tacking or bartacking
Specialized sewing stitch designed to provide tensile strength to the product it is used on, for reinforcing areas of stress on a garment, such as pocket openings.

definition-item.definition-title: {consisting of lateral displacement of the workpieces by a feed-dog or a fluted presser foot}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
E.g. machines with accessory devices controlled by the presser foot, with fluted means having grooves to improve friction.

definition-item.definition-title: Sewing apparatus or machines not otherwise provided for (for making zip closures A44B19/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

E.g. sewing machines for sewing straw hats, straw cases, wisps of straw, canvas shoes, for hemming hats, ribbing corsets, binding or uniting carpets, assembling parts of knitted panties or closing toe parts of stockings.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sewing apparatus or machines for making zip closures

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Codes related to use of special elements
Indexing Codes related to use of special materials
Indexing Codes related to use of special materials
Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing

definition-item.definition-title: {Sewing units for assembling parts of knitted panties or closing the stocking toe part}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sewing units for assembling parts of knitted panties or closing the stocking toe part, after the knitting operation has been processed.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hosiery, panti-hose
Indexing Codes related to use of special materials
Indexing Codes related to applied objects or articles
Indexing Code related to hosiery, panti-hose

section-body.paragraph-text: Machines for assembling knitted panties or stockings provided with means for sewing and other operations (e.g. turning the material inside-out, trimming the seam edges) are classified in the field where the alleged invention lies. A combined sewing machine with a turning inside-out mechanism where the invention lies in the turning inside-out of the material is classified in D06G3/00 only. A combined sewing machine with trimming of the hosiery or seamed edges where the invention lies in the trimming is classified in D06C13/12 only.

definition-item.definition-title: Sewing units consisting of combinations of several sewing machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sewing units consisting of combinations of several sewing machines which can be mounted in series or in parallel, incorporating e.g. conveying devices and devices not incorporated in the sewing machines for supplying and removing the work.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Codes related to use of special materials
Indexing Codes related to applied objects or articles
Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing
Indexing Codes related to textile applications

section-body.paragraph-text: Machines provided with means for sewing and other operations (e.g. turning the material inside-out) are classified in the field where the alleged invention lies. A combined sewing machine with a turning inside-out mechanism where the invention lies in the turning inside-out of the material is classified in D06G3/00 only.

definition-item.definition-title: Work-feeding means

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Work-feeding means forming part of the sewing machine, e.g. feed dogs, rotary circular feed members, sewing needles, used in order to move the work through the sewing machine.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Feed dogs
A part of a sewing machine that feeds the work under the needle.

definition-item.definition-title: Pressers; Presser feet (for feeding D05B27/04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
pressers and presser feet resting on the work and pressing it down upon the table of the sewing machine.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Presser feet for feeding the work

definition-item.definition-title: Workpiece holders or hold-downs in machines for sewing leather

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Workpiece holders or hold-downs in machines for sewing leather, e.g. balls, shoes.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices incorporated in sewing machines for supplying or removing the work

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for supplying or removing the work, e.g. conveying devices, feeding workpieces separated from piles.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Work-feeding means, e.g. feed dogs, rotary circular feed members

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing
Indexing Codes related to textile applications

definition-item.definition-title: Work-feeding or -handling elements not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Work-feeding or work-handling elements for specific applications, e.g. for facilitating seaming, hem-turning elements, for attaching bands, ribbons, strips, for binding, ruching, gathering, casing, filling lace, pleating devices, cuttlers, curlers, edge guides, indicators for positioning work.

definition-item.definition-title: for facilitating seaming; Hem-turning elements; Hemmers {(D05B35/062 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Codes related to applied objects or articles
Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hem
Border of a cloth article doubled back and stitched down.

definition-item.definition-title: for attaching bands, ribbons, strips, or tapes or for binding

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Label feeding
Attaching cords, tapes, bands or the like in embroidery machines

definition-item.definition-title: {for attaching slide fasteners (connection of the interlocking member to the stringer tape A44B19/40)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connection of separate, or one piece, interlocking members to stringer tapes and reinforcing such connections, e.g. by stitching

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sewing hooks, e.g. to a tape

definition-item.definition-title: for ruching, gathering, casing, or filling lace, ribbons, or bindings; Pleating devices; Cuttlers; Gathering feet; Crimpers; Curlers; Rufflers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing
Pleating, kilting, or goffering fabrics or wearing apparel by heat and/or steam

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ruching lace
Forming a pleat of lace for trimming a work
Ruffler
Attachment on a sewing machine used for making frills
Crimper
A mechanical device consisting of a cylindrical tube around which the work is wound to curl it

definition-item.definition-title: {for making folds transversely to the sewing direction}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines for making folds transversely to the sewing direction, e.g. rufflers.

definition-item.definition-title: {Fixed or adjustable pin holding the work, e.g. for circular or spiral stitching}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sewing machines with devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch-forming mechanism in order to obtain spiral seams

definition-item.definition-title: Devices incorporated in sewing machines for slitting, grooving, or cutting (severing sewing-threads D05B65/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices incorporated in sewing machines for slitting, grooving or cutting the work.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices incorporated in sewing machines for severing sewing-threads

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slitting
Forming a long and narrow cut
Grooving
Forming a long narrow channel

definition-item.definition-title: with oscillating tools

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cutting devices with oscillating tools, i.e. tools swinging back and forth with a steady, uninterrupted rhythm, not just moving up and down.

definition-item.definition-title: {Pinking}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pinking
is forming a perforated pattern.

definition-item.definition-title: {Pinking}

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pinking
is forming a perforated pattern.

definition-item.definition-title: Workpiece carriers (for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier to obtain particular configuration of seam D05B21/00; in general A41H15/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Workpiece carriers, e.g. for cap, support structures, sewing frames.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for automatically controlling movement of work-carrier relative to stitch forming mechanism in order to obtain particular configuration of seam
Cloth-holders
Indexing Code related to selection of machines, accessories or parts of the same kind
Indexing Codes related to use of special elements
Indexing Codes related to use of special materials
Indexing Codes related to applied objects or articles
Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing

definition-item.definition-title: {Quilting frames}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Quilting frames in sewing machines.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for sewing quilts or mattresses
Appliances for holding or feeding the base fabric in embroidering machines

definition-item.definition-title: Work-collecting devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Work-collecting devices, e.g. worktables, stack support assemblies.

definition-item.definition-title: Spool-pin assemblies incorporated in sewing machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Spool-pin assemblies incorporated in sewing machines for holding spools.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applications of bobbin-winding or -changing devices

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spool pin
is a pin on which the spool of thread is seated.

definition-item.definition-title: Applications of measuring devices for determining the length of threads used in sewing machines (measuring devices in embroidery machines D05C, in general G01B)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Applications of measuring devices for determining the length of threads used in sewing machines, e.g. in order to cut the thread after performing sewing, to control the speed, to determine the thread reserve.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applications of devices for metering predetermined lengths of running material
Measuring devices for use with embroidery machines
Measuring length in general

definition-item.definition-title: Needle-thread tensioning devices; Applications of tensometers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Needle thread tensioning devices and applications of tensometers, i.e. devices controlling the needle thread in order to avoid a defective stitching or a broken thread.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: thread tensioning arrangements in embroidery machines
Indexing Codes related to use of special elements

definition-item.definition-title: Applications of tensometers (application of tension indicators in handling thin or filamentary material B65H59/40; for embroidery machines D05C11/08; tensometers in general G01L)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applications of tension indicators in handling thin and filamentary material
Thread-tensioning arrangements in embroidering machines
Tensometers in general

definition-item.definition-title: Take-up devices, e.g. levers, for the needle thread

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Take-up devices, e.g. levers, for the needle thread, in order to provide enough thread for the loop and preventing knotted wads of thread.

definition-item.definition-title: Applications of needle-thread guards; Thread-break detectors (for embroidery machines D05C11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Applications of needle-thread guards and thread-break detectors, i.e. devices for guiding the needle thread and for detecting the absence of the thread, respectively.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applications of needle-thread guards and thread-break detectors for embroidery machines

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Needle-thread guard
Mechanical element preventing skipping stitches

definition-item.definition-title: Thread- or cord-laying mechanisms; Thread fingers

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Thread laying mechanism
A device used to guide the thread in order to manage the stitches when a smooth and flat finish is desired.

definition-item.definition-title: Needle holders; Needle bars (needles D05B85/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Needle holders and needle bars, e.g. devices for fastening needles to needle bars, needle guides, needle-bar drives.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Needles

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for fastening needles to needle bars

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for fastening needles to needle bars for all kinds of needles.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for fastening or inserting needles in bars or carriers in embroidery machines
Indexing Code related to selection of machines, accessories or parts of the same kind

definition-item.definition-title: Needle guides; Needle protectors (finger-protecting devices D05B83/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Needle guides and needle protectors, exclusively designed to guide and protect the needle, not to guide with regard to the needle or protect from the needle.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Finger protecting devices

definition-item.definition-title: Loop takers, e.g. loopers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Loop takers and loopers, i.e. mechanisms placed underneath the workpiece for grabbing the loop of thread before the needle pulls up, and wrapping it around either another piece of thread or another loop in the same piece of thread.

definition-item.definition-title: Applications of bobbin-winding or -changing devices; Indicating or control devices associated therewith

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bobbin holders or casings, case guards, bobbin discharge devices
Application of bobbins for storing the lower thread

definition-item.definition-title: Loop holders; Loop spreaders; Stitch-forming fingers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Loop holders, loop spreaders and stitch-forming fingers, i.e. devices retaining the loop of the needle thread underneath the workpiece until the following operation.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices associated with the loop-taker thread, e.g. for tensioning

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices associated with the loop-taker thread, e.g. for tensioning, monitoring.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for severing the needle or lower thread

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices for severing the needle or lower thread, e.g. knife, heated tool, and for disposing of the severed thread end. Cutting devices inside or associated with the thread disposal device are covered by D05B65/06.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for cutting the needle or lower thread in embroidery machines
Indexing Codes related to applied objects or articles
Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing

definition-item.definition-title: and for disposing of the severed thread end{; Catching or wiping devices for the severed thread}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices for severing the needle or lower thread and for disposing of the severed end, only if the cutting device is inside or associated with the thread disposal device, e.g. catching or wiping devices for the severed thread.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices incorporated in sewing machines for lubricating, waxing, or colouring the threads

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Moistening, sizing, oiling, waxing, colouring or drying filamentary material as additional measures during package formation
Devices for dyeing or impregnating the threads in embroidery machines
Treatment of fibres, threads and yarns not provided for elsewhere

definition-item.definition-title: Driving-gear; Control devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Driving gear and control devices defined by the structure, e.g. mechanical, fluid, electrical, or by the application, e.g. changing speed, stopping drive, or by details.

definition-item.definition-title: Lubricating or cooling devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Lbricating or cooling devices, e.g. for loop-taker, needle, taking the workpiece into consideration.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubricating devices in embroidery machines

definition-item.definition-title: for free-arm sewing machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fee-arm sewing machines, i.e. machines having an arm holding bobbin, shuttle and feed dogs.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for converting free-arm sewing machines into flat-bed machines

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: A free-arm sewing machine
has a shape allowing the fabric to slip around the arm.

definition-item.definition-title: Frames, stands, tables, or other furniture adapted to carry sewing machines (furniture aspects A47B, A47C)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

frames, stands, tables, or the like adapted to carry sewing machines, e.g. for drop-head sewing machines, with noise-suppressing devices, and arrangements for mounting sewing-machine casings to frames, stands or tables.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Furniture aspects of frames, stands, tables or the like adapted to carry sewing machines
Chairs

definition-item.definition-title: for drop-head sewing machines

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: A drop-head sewing machine
machine e.g. foldable, with multi-position adjustment.

definition-item.definition-title: Covers, or portable enclosures, for sewing machines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Covers, or portable enclosures, for sewing machines, e.g. case cover, bed extension table, shield assembly.

definition-item.definition-title: Incorporations or adaptations of lighting equipment

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Incorporations or adaptations of lighting equipment in sewing machines, e.g. lights, magnifying glasses.

definition-item.definition-title: Sewing machines incorporating devices serving purposes other than sewing, e.g. for blowing air, for grinding

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
sewing machines incorporating devices serving purposes other than sewing, e.g. for blowing air, for grinding, for discharging material, vacuum boxes, brushes.

definition-item.definition-title: Guards or like devices for preventing injury to operator (machine safety devices in general F16P)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Guards or like devices for preventing injury to operator, e.g. preventing fingers to be pierced by the needle.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safety devices in general

definition-item.definition-title: Needles (surgical needles A61B17/06; manufacture of needles B21G1/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Needles, e.g. hooked needles, curved needles, flexible needles, hollow needles.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Surgical needles, e.g. for sewing body parts

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making needles used for performing operations (i.e. manufacture of needles)
Quilting needles for making upholstery
Machine needles in embroidery machines

definition-item.definition-title: Needle- {or looper-} threading devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Needle- or looper-threading devices, i.e. devices for positioning the thread in the needle eye or in the looper, e.g. with mechanical means.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for filling or threading shuttles
Indexing Codes related to use of special elements

definition-item.definition-title: Seam-ripping devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Seam ripping devices, e.g. for ripping out or opening the seam.

definition-item.definition-title: Tools, implements, or accessories for hand sewing (needles, needle threaders D05B85/00, D05B87/00; appliances for the tailoring trade A41H)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Needles
Needle threading devices
Appliances or methods for making clothes, e.g. for dress making, for tailoring (e.g. boxes for needles)

definition-item.definition-title: Bodkins

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Bodkins, i.e. small pointed instrument used for piercing holes in cloth or instrument with a knobbed point and a large eye for drawing tape or cord through a hem.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Needles for hand knitting
Crocheting tools
Tools for hand knotting carpets or tapestries
Hand tufting needles

definition-item.definition-title: Thimbles; Finger shields; Palm protectors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Finger protectors for knitting

definition-item.definition-title: Tool receptacles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Boxes for needles or pins

definition-item.definition-title: Thread-spool receptacles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tool receptacles for hand sewing

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Holders for embroidering needles or threads

definition-item.definition-title: Stitches; Stitch seams

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Stitches and stitch seams, e.g. combined with machine sewing, knitting, strengthened by auxiliary elements.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applied objects or articles
Operations on the work before or after sewing

definition-item.definition-title: Preparatory or finishing operations in connection with hand sewing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparatory or finishing operations in connection with hand sewing, e.g. softening material prior to sewing, flattening, pounding, or pressing stitched seams.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Indexing Codes related to operations on the work before or after sewing

definition-item.definition-title: Flattening, pounding, or pressing stitched seams (in shoemaking A43D8/44)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Creasing presses in shoemaking

definition-item.definition-title: Hand sewing processes or apparatus for special work or not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Hand sewing processes or apparatus for special work or not otherwise provided for, e.g. hand-guided apparatus, for darning, using special threads, for attaching buttons or fasteners, for attaching patches.
